imp.core.parser

Class OBJToImpParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • imp.core.parser.OBJToImpParser

  • public class OBJToImpParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for parsing .obj files into the float buffers needed to create the 3D models in IMP.
    Author:
    kuszewskij

      • OBJToImpParser

        public OBJToImpParser(java.lang.String fileName)
               throws NullParameterException,
                      java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                      OBJFileFormatException
        Creates a parser and parses through the file given as a parameter
        Parameters:
        Filename - The file name of the file to parse through
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws this exception if the file specified was not found.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws this exception if there was a problem parsing through the file.
        OBJFileFormatException
        NullParameterException

    • Method Detail

      • loadFile

        public void loadFile(java.lang.String fileName)
              throws NullParameterException,
                     java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                     OBJFileFormatException
        Calling this method will load the given file into the parser and pull out the information it needs to create 3D IMP models from the .obj file. The given file must be in obj format.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the obj file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown if the passed in file is not in a valid format.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Throws this exception if the file that is specified could not be found.
        OBJFileFormatException
        NullParameterException

      • getFaces

        public Vec3[] getFaces()
        Returns:
        Returns the buffer containing the faces for the shape(s). If a file has not been previously loaded, then it will return null. If a file has been successfully loaded, then it will return an array of Vec3s defining all the faces for this model. Each three consecutive Vec3 will define 1 face. The attributes of the Vec3 will be as follows x: The index into the vertex buffer defining the geographic location of the point of the face. y: The Index into the texture array defining the UV coordinate in the texture associated with this point in the face. z: The index into the normal array associated with the normal for this vertex in the face. If any of these attributes are not defined for the face in the OBJ file, then the associated attribute in the Vec3 will be null. The x value defining the geographic location will always be non null if a face has been defined.

      • getNormals

        public java.lang.Float[] getNormals()
        Returns:
        Returns the buffer containing the normal vectors for the shape(s). If a file has not been previously loaded, then it will return null.

      • getTextureUVCoordinates

        public java.lang.Float[] getTextureUVCoordinates()
        Returns:
        Returns the buffer containing the UV coordinates for textures used on the shape(s). If a file has not been previously loaded, then it will return null.

      • getVertices

        public java.lang.Float[] getVertices()
        Returns:
        Returns the buffer containing the vertices for the shape(s). If a file has not been previously loaded, then it will return null.

      • getRefferencedTextures

        public java.util.List<com.jogamp.opengl.util.texture.Texture> getRefferencedTextures()
        Returns:
        Returns the buffer containing the vertices for the shape(s). If a file has not been previously loaded, then it will return null.

      • getTextureMapings

        public java.util.List<Vec2> getTextureMapings()
        Returns:
        Returns the buffer containing the vertices for the shape(s). If a file has not been previously loaded, then it will return null.

      • getNameOfLoadedFile

        public java.lang.String getNameOfLoadedFile()
        Returns:
